intro: Geigeria nianganensis, commonly known as the Nigerian geigeria, is a flowering plant native to West Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and has lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture. Its flowers are yellow and bloom in the summer months, attracting various pollinators. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
